response.overview: Broadcast in January 2004, A&E's Live by Request: John Fogerty captured the legendary musician in an intimate yet electrifying concert setting from Sony Music Studios in New York City. The performance was driven entirely by viewer phone calls, resulting in a dynamic setlist that spanned his iconic career with Creedence Clearwater Revival and his solo work. Backed by a tight band that included drumming legend Kenny Aronoff, Fogerty delivered powerful, fan-chosen renditions of classics like "Proud Mary," "Bad Moon Rising," and "Fortunate Son," alongside celebrated solo hits such as "Centerfield" and "The Old Man Down the Road." The special showcased not only his enduring catalog and distinctive raspy vocals but also his masterful guitar work and infectious energy, creating a unique and personal concert experience for the television audience.
response.title: Live by Request: John Fogerty
